images.caption: This avenue takes you from an entrance on Croydon Road to the bridge over the River Wandle and The Grange beyond it. Taken on a May evening with the sun in the west casting shadows of the trees across the path.

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / Cycle track to Carshalton, in Beddington Park
images.caption: Cycle track to Carshalton. The London Borough of Sutton, which is responsible for this area, has for many years been a keen promoter of sustainable transport. A network of cycle tracks has been established, and this one through Beddington Park must be one of the most attractive.

description: This park near Carshalton has good footpaths to follow along the River Wandle and around the pretty lake. There are 58 hectares of landscaped wooded park and the Carew family Manor house to enjoy. Beddinton Park has a fascinating history with the site of a Roman villa and bath-house at the northern side of the park. The park can be accessed from the nearby Hackbridge Station. If you are coming by bike then you can follow the Wandle Trail from Wandsworth or Croydon. If you head north you will soon come to Morden Hall Park and Mitcham Common. You can virtually explore part of the park using the google street view link below!

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a lovely place for a dog walk so you're likely to see other people with their pets on your visit.

display_address: Church Road, Beddington, London Borough of Sutton, London, Greater London, England, SM6 7BE, United Kingdom
